section.title: Overview
section.para: MindComputing Knowledge is an intuitive full featured web-based application designed to be used. We will describe how to get the most value out of Knowledge by using its key features, such as search, creating a new concept, creating value sets, running the classifier, and exporting your work in Solor's RF2 compatible format and the future Solor's object release format.

Knowledge is based on HSPC's project Solor. Knowledge has similar functionality to Solor's desktop application but Knowledge also differs. Our most basic difference is that Knowledge has defined a REST API and is a web-based applicaiton. Knowledge utilizes Solor's common model approach to integrating Meaningful Use Standards (SNOMED CT, LOINC and RxNorm) and local terminologies to import into the Knowledge application. In addition, Knowledge can also load Meaningful Use Standards and local terminologies without utilizing Solor's common model integration.
The Knowledge application has 3 components the: Editor, Manager, and a Terminology Server:

listitem.para: The Knowledge Editor provides all authoring functionality, such as creating new concepts, modify concepts, creating value sets, modifying value sets, classifying, search, mapping and exporting content. The application supports the SNOMED CT RF2, and Solor RF2 compatible export out-of-the-box.

The Knowledge Manager provides user administration functions, such as user creation, disabling a user, and user roles within a project. In addition, Manager has project management functions such as, project creation.

Our Terminology Server supports runtime terminology requirements. This includes a complete implementation of Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) Application Programming Interface (API) as an enterprise cloud computing service.

section.title: Knowledge Editor
section.para:
The Editor is an interactive application that allows you to: search, view, edit concepts, create new concepts, and create valuesets. By default, the Editor is divided into 3 areas: the task paneband the concept viewer pane, and navigation. When you select a concept on the task pane, its details can be viewed in the concept viewer on the right.
